title: Dem campaigns get desperate after debate shutout
text:
POLITICO Illustration/AP Photo nerdcast Dem campaigns get desperate after debate shutout Staffers for several candidates are starting to discuss collective action they can take against the DNC’s debate rules.

Subscribe and rate the Nerdcast on Apple Podcasts.

This week on the Nerdcast with Scott Bland: More than half of the Democratic presidential field got bounced from the party’s debate circuit Wednesday night, but they’re not meekly exiting stage left. Elena Schnieder explains what actions they might take against the DNC’s debate rules. Also, voters across the country — from California to Pennsylvania to Massachusetts — grilled House Democrats on the potential impeachment of President Donald Trump at a series of events this month. Reporter Sarah Ferris describes what she observed on the ground at town halls.
description: Staffers for several candidates are starting to discuss collective action they can take against the DNC’s debate rules.
